meanings.definition: The action of preordaining or the state of being preordained.
meanings.sent1: The preordainments of fate cannot be changed.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the preordainments of destiny.
meanings.sent3: The preordainments of the weather made everyone carry umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: His success felt like a preordainment from above.
meanings.sent5: The preordainments of the prophecy were finally coming true.

meanings.definition: Something that is preordained or predetermined.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll revealed the preordainments of kings.
meanings.sent2: He accepted the preordainments of life with grace.
meanings.sent3: The preordainments of the menu made her order the same dish every time.
meanings.sent4: The preordainments of history were evident in the ruins of the city.
meanings.sent5: The preordainments of the test results were a pleasant surprise.
